alert.note: Alert for Orange; Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 26 at 5:18PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Orange and Seminole. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 517 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Orlando, Altamonte Springs, Oviedo, Winter Springs, Winter Park, Casselberry, Maitland, College Park, Goldenrod, Pine Hills, Oak Ridge, Fairview Shores, Orlando Executive Airport, Fern Park, Orlovista, Edgewood, Eatonville, Aloma and Holden Heights. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
